meta.name: description
meta.content: Abernathy ISD is a public K-12 school district in Abernathy, Texas.

div.div: AHS Cheer/Mascot Tryout will be on April 9th! This will be done virtually. Upcoming 9th, 10th, 11th, or 12th graders- if interested, click on this article for more information.

h3.a: AISD Learn at Home to Begin Tuesday, March 31

div.div: AISD instruction will begin on Tuesday, March 31. See the link here to find access to your child's lessons and other resources. Your campus principal will be reaching out to you about specifics for lesson pickup and drop-off. Together we will make sure that our experience with at-home learning is a good one.

img.alt: An Update From Our Superintendent Aaron Waldrip Featured Photo

h3.a: An Update From Our Superintendent Aaron Waldrip

div.div:
Updated March 19, 2020: With the recent developments of COVID-19, and Governor Abbott's executive order, Abernathy ISD will close until further notice. We will use next week, March 23-30, to prepare instruction and continue developing our remote learning plan, which will begin Tuesday, March 31. Parents, please be on the lookout for Technology Surveys coming soon to help us learn how we can best support your child's continued learning.
Food service will continue Monday, March 23, and free breakfast and lunch will be available for all children 18 and under. Parents will be able to pick up meals curbside in front of the elementary main entrance. More details and instruction, including times, will be provided tomorrow.
UIL announced today that it is extending its suspension of all UIL sanctioned activities, including all contests, practices, rehearsals, and workouts until May 4.
All Abernathy ISD activities that were scheduled to take place while the school is closed are cancelled. Prom is postponed until further notice. A decision on graduation will be made at a later date.

Abernathy Independent School District encompasses 179 square miles in Hale and Lubbock Counties. The district has an enrollment of a little over 780 students. AISD offers a half-day Pre-K program, full day Kindergarten, a school-wide Title I program, vocational programs, dual credit courses, band, athletics, special education, and gifted/talented classes. Abernathy ISD students have the opportunity to graduate with 36 hours of college credit.
The mission of the Abernathy ISD is to provide a challenging environment for students to become prepared, confident, and well-rounded men and women of integrity.

AISD has been recognized by TEA for its attendance rate, number of graduates on the Recommended Program, college preparedness in English-Language Arts and Math. In prior years all 3 campuses have been recognized for their test scores in writing, reading, math and science. Abernathy High School has been identified as one of the top schools in the state in English-Language Arts by Texas Monthly.

AISD stresses technology on all campuses. Currently, the district has approximately 600 computers including two labs on each campus all connected to the internet via a 100 Mb connection to Region 17 for Internet and Distance Learning. AISD also maintains a wireless network on all campuses, including wireless laptop carts. Each classroom is also equipped with a Promethean interactive board and projector, and all Elementary classrooms have at least 4 student computers.
The district and campuses continue to meet the standards of the new more rigorous accountability system with distinctions.
